heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 47.89mm with a maximum intensity of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (212°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 198 m), rainfall (down 2.0 mm), feels like temperature (down 2.7°C), and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 60.1m lower than yesterday, 198.4m lower than the past week, 184.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 523m and a peak of 933m, averaging 584.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and it’s dark. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
